intro: Dodonaea aspleniifolia var. arborescens, commonly known as the silver dollar tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its small, round, silver-green leaves that resemble silver dollars. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm climates.
